title: Issue during Create Labeled Videos - Key error for Individual 1
body:
**Windows 10, DeepLabCut Version 2.2rc1, with an Anaconda Environment** **Describe the problem** Hello! I'm attempting to create a video after refining tracklets and following the steps so far, but i'm running into a key error when i'm attempting to render a video. In the input, i used the same config.yaml file, and my input is in the video folder - not my pickle file or any of the labeled videos, as those couldn't be read through the GUI. The specified tracker method is ellipses, and i didn't get this error when creating the labels, training the dataset, or refining the tracklets. Please place code inside this:
Code output

Creating a video with the ellipse tracker method! 2021-05-13 12:04:29.470564: I tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:44] Successfully opened dynamic library cudart64_100.dll C:\Users\write\Documents\Grad School\RVT\Rat Projects\Rat Videos\Rat_Videos\models\DLC Downscaled already exists! Starting to process video: C:\Users\write\Documents\Grad School\RVT\Rat Projects\Rat Videos\Rat_Videos\models\DLC Downscaled\E1E6_320.mp4 Loading C:\Users\write\Documents\Grad School\RVT\Rat Projects\Rat Videos\Rat_Videos\models\DLC Downscaled\E1E6_320.mp4 and data. Labeled video already created. Skipping... Loading C:\Users\write\Documents\Grad School\RVT\Rat Projects\Rat Videos\Rat_Videos\models\DLC Downscaled\E1E6_320.mp4 and data. C:\Users\write\Documents\Grad School\RVT\Rat Projects\Rat Videos\Rat_Videos\models\DLC Downscaled\plot-poses\E1E6_320 already exists! Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\base.py", line 3080, in get_loc return self._engine.get_loc(casted_key) File "pandas\_libs\index.pyx", line 70, in pandas._libs.index.IndexEngine.get_loc File "pandas\_libs\index.pyx", line 101, in pandas._libs.index.IndexEngine.get_loc File "pandas\_libs\hashtable_class_helper.pxi", line 4554, in pandas._libs.hashtable.PyObjectHashTable.get_item File "pandas\_libs\hashtable_class_helper.pxi", line 4562, in pandas._libs.hashtable.PyObjectHashTable.get_item KeyError: 'individual1' The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception: Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\create_videos.py", line 363, in create_videos track_method=self.trackertypes.GetValue(), File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\plotting.py", line 279, in plot_trajectories linewidth=linewidth, File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\plotting.py", line 51, in PlottingResults Dataframe = Dataframe.loc(axis=1)[:, individuals2plot] File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexing.py", line 889, in __getitem__ return self._getitem_tuple(key) File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexing.py", line 1060, in _getitem_tuple return self._getitem_lowerdim(tup) File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexing.py", line 787, in _getitem_lowerdim return self._getitem_axis(tup, axis=axis) File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexing.py", line 1117, in _getitem_axis locs = labels.get_locs(key) File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\multi.py", line 3305, in get_locs self.get_loc_level(k, level=i, drop_level=False)[0] File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\multi.py", line 2965, in get_loc_level return self._get_loc_level(key, level=level, drop_level=drop_level) File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\multi.py", line 3068, in _get_loc_level indexer = self._get_level_indexer(key, level=level) File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\multi.py", line 3158, in _get_level_indexer idx = self._get_loc_single_level_index(level_index, key) File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\multi.py", line 2809, in _get_loc_single_level_index return level_index.get_loc(key) File "C:\Users\write\anaconda3\envs\tf\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\base.py", line 3082, in get_loc raise KeyError(key) from err KeyError: 'individual1'

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to '...' 2. Click on '....' 3. Scroll down to '....' 4. See error **Screenshots** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74156405/118174337-89749880-b3e3-11eb-8bf5-04b5d51a81f0.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74156405/118174394-98f3e180-b3e3-11eb-9f44-dcd779c8835b.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74156405/118174421-a0b38600-b3e3-11eb-8a6f-1bf62318f258.png) **Additional context** I've included screenshots of my config file in Atom in case there is an issue with the skeleton. Since the error is for individual 1, i assumed there was something wrong with the formatting there, but i can't find anything. Thanks for all of this incredible stuff, Mathis team!
